text:
That means that the RD Gateway has lost connection with the domain controller,
or domain controllers, in the destination forest/domain. 
Are you getting a “lost trust” issue? 
Philip Elder MCTS 
Senior Technical Architect 
Microsoft High Availability MVP
 
E-mail:  
Phone: +1 (780) 458-2028 
Web: www.mpecsinc.com
 
Blog: blog.mpecsinc.com

Skype: MPECSInc. 
Please note: Although we may sometimes respond to email, text and phone calls
instantly at all hours of the day, our regular business hours are 8:00 AM - 5:00
PM, Monday thru Friday.

metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] RE: RDP NLA Issue

From: 'Brown, Jeff' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, February 1, 2024 07:17
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: [patchmanagement] RDP NLA Issue 
All, 
Does anyone have ideas about to resolve this issue? 
We have several Server 2022 hosts on a Server 2022 domain.  Every few weeks our
international employees can no longer RDP to these machines.  They get a “The
remote computer that you are trying to connect to requires Network Level
Authentication (NLA), but your Windows domain controller cannot be contacted to
perform NLA…” error message. 
I can still RDP to these hosts without issue and removing/readding the machines
to the same domain clears the problem for a while. 
--
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/a2511955d01e4317933ad9f24ba0a96d%40MPECSInc.Ca
